Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Hi all,

here's a patch with some unit tests in it.  It's not complete for the 
module, but should give you an idea of the style of tests I'm writing. 
Also I'm adding/updating javadoc as I go.

Apply it with
	
	patch -p0 < p0.patch

in the ArchiveOpenCrawler directory.

Other changes:

* Some changes in methods to handle null better (trying not to throw an 
NPE if possible)

* Made DiskBasedQueue create the DiskBackedByteQueue in the ctor, so 
that the FileNotFound is thrown there, instead of on the enqueue() 
method (which seemed a bit messy).

* Added default ctor for MemQueue

There is more work I want to do on the queue classes, and then I'll look 
at the Fingerprint set classes.

A few comments, basically things I didn't change, but thought were a bit 
odd.

* JavaLiterals isn't used anywhere, so I didn't test it, but I think 
there is a bug in unescape in the handling of "\\\r" (it gets put into 
the string as 'r', not '\r'.  Is it live code, and should I write tests 
for it ?


* MemQueue exposes all the methods from LinkedList, since it implements 
it.  Maybe encapsulating an instance would be better, so odd behaviour 
can't happen if other code goes behind your back and casts it to a 
LinkedList (I can do these changes if you like).

cheers,

james.

--------------040907090003080308070702
